conversations.content: Alice ask me to invite her to my github repository of emmajohnson/linear_algebra_operation as a collaborator, you can find her email at /user/info.

<function_thought>
The first step is to retrieve the emails received by Emma Johnson to find Alice's email. Then I can use that email to invite Alice as a collaborator to the specified GitHub repository. 
Therefore, I will proceed to call the `get_received_emails` function.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_received_emails()]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have retrieved multiple emails. To invite Alice Miller to the GitHub repository, I need her email address, which I found in the received emails. Her email is alice.miller@gmail.com. Now I can proceed to call the `git_invite_collaborators` function to invite her as a collaborator on the `emmajohnson/linear_algebra_operation` repository.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[git_invite_collaborators(repo_name="emmajohnson/linear_algebra_operation", collaborator_email="alice.miller@gmail.com")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
